concept.title: Referencing Field Names
concept.shortdesc: Stages display a field name with a preceding slash as follows: /<field name>. For example, a field named CITY displays as /CITY.

conbody.p: After you preview data or select fields using preview data, you can generally select fields from a list. When a list is not available or when you want to define a new field name, type in the field name with a preceding slash.

For example, when you define an output field for an Expression Evaluator, you can select from a list of fields passed from the previous stage. But to create a new field for the results of the expression, you enter a field name, such as /Code.
